intro: Kibaropsis, commonly known as the silverleaf kibaropsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions. It has small, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss, and its flowers bloom in late spring or early summer. Kibaropsis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
